faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without Spanish citizenship or residency. The process is straightforward: obtain a NIE (tax identification number), hire a local solicitor, conduct due diligence, and complete purchase through a notary. British citizens and other EU nationals have equal rights. Many international buyers in Hondón de las Nieves have completed purchases smoothly within 6-8 weeks.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-10% of property price: transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), property registry (0.1%), and legal/administrative fees (1-2%). For this €365,900 villa, expect approximately €29,000-36,000 in additional costs. Avoid surprises by budgeting upfront with your Spanish solicitor who will itemize all expenses.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish and international lenders offer mortgages to non-residents. Typical terms: 70-80% LTV, 15-30 year periods, competitive interest rates. Documentation includes proof of income, credit history, and employment verification. British buyers often qualify easily. Mortgage specialists familiar with international buyers can guide the process, often arranging 60-70% financing on this property.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Hondón de las Nieves is remarkably affordable—30-40% less than northern Europe and southern UK. Groceries are inexpensive (Mercadona/Lidl offer excellent value), utilities average €80-120 monthly, and dining out costs €10-15 per person. Property taxes and community fees are minimal. A family of four can live comfortably on €1,800-2,200 monthly including mortgage payments, making Spain's inland areas ideal for budget-conscious families.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle adaptée aux retraités ?
faqs.answer: Absolutely, Costa Blanca is excellent for retirees. Mild climate eliminates harsh winters, healthcare is accessible and affordable, cost of living is low, and established expat communities provide social engagement. Hondón de las Nieves appeals particularly to retirees seeking authentic Spanish villages rather than built-up coastal towns. Many retirees rent homes during summer months to offset ownership costs.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport is approximately 50 km from Hondón de las Nieves (1 hour drive) with direct flights to UK cities. Flight time from London is 2.5-3 hours, with frequent daily departures. Budget airlines keep costs low (€30-80 return). The distance makes Costa Blanca ideal for UK families maintaining home connections while establishing Spanish residency—easily weekend accessible yet committed enough for genuine lifestyle change.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate: warm, dry summers (25-32°C) and mild winters (8-15°C). Hondón de las Nieves, at 500m elevation, is slightly cooler than coastal areas—a significant advantage reducing summer air conditioning costs. Over 320 days of sunshine annually enable outdoor family activities most of the year. Rainfall is minimal (4-5 months concentrate rain), rarely disrupting plans. The climate is ideal for families appreciating outdoor living without extreme heat.
